meanings.definition: Capable of being manipulated or controlled.
meanings.sent1: The toy was manipulatable, allowing children to easily change its shape.
meanings.sent2: The flexible material was manipulatable, making it simple to mold into different forms.
meanings.sent3: The manipulatable clay kept shifting in the artist's hands, creating funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her manipulatable emotions were like clay in the hands of others, easily shaped.
meanings.sent5: The manipulatable fabric could be twisted and turned into various designs.

meanings.definition: Able to be influenced or handled.
meanings.sent1: The negotiator was skilled at dealing with manipulatable situations.
meanings.sent2: The puppy was so manipulatable, responding well to training commands.
meanings.sent3: The manipulatable kitten purred happily as it was gently petted.
meanings.sent4: Her manipulatable opinions were like putty in the hands of persuasive speakers.
meanings.sent5: The manipulatable plant grew quickly when given proper care and attention.

meanings.definition: Susceptible to being altered or managed.
meanings.sent1: The data was manipulatable, allowing for easy adjustments to the graphs.
meanings.sent2: The system was manipulatable, enabling users to customize their settings.
meanings.sent3: The manipulatable recipe turned out surprisingly delicious with a few tweaks.
meanings.sent4: His manipulatable schedule was carefully organized to fit in all his tasks.
meanings.sent5: The manipulatable material could be easily shaped into different forms with heat.
